result.execSummary:
The defendant William J. Shecterle was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manufacture/Deliver THC (<=200g), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(h)1.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Jail term is with huber
Consecutive to: to any other sentence in being

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. William J. Shecterle

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
11:00 am - DA calls case and states appearances and agreement reached.  Defendant William J. Shecterle in court with attorney James Richard Lex.  Defendant in custody.  Mark T. Fuhr appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Off record at 11:01 am.  Back on record at 11:05 am  Atty Lex provides waiver of preliminary hearing form.  Court questions DE regarding waiver.  Court accepts waiver.  DA files information, it is acknowleged by parties and reading is waived.  DE enters plea of NO CONTEST to all counts.  Court questions DE regarding the plea.  DA explains elements of charge.  Court finds plea/waiver to be free, etc.  Court finds factual basis does exist.  Court accepts plea, finds DE guilty and orders entry of JOC.  DE to submit DNA sample at PRSO.

Court imposes:
6 month jail with huber, consecutive to any other in being 
$300 fine, 30 days from release to pay fine and costs or CO
$250 DNAAS
$60 in Buy money to PPD 

DA agrees to not charge Price County case number 15-2441

Court advises DE regarding loss of rights as a felon

Appeal rights given.
Plea/sentencing hearing on October 25, 2016 at 11:00 am.
Preliminary hearing on October 25, 2016 at 11:00 am.

Defendant William J. Shecterle in court with attorney James Richard Lex.  Defendant in custody.  Mark T. Fuhr appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Complaint acknowledged, reading waived.  Preliminary hearing requested, time limits waived.  Court orders Pre-trial conference be scheduled.  Bond to continue.
Adjourned initial appearance on July 5, 2016 at 10:00 am.

Defendant William J. Shecterle appeared, in custody.  Mark T. Fuhr appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Complaint acknowledged, reading waived.  DE plans to retain an attorney.  Court gives DE another notice of right to atty.  To be adjourned to another date.
States Demand for Discovery and Notice of Intent to Use DNA Evidence

If not already completed DE must submit to booking at Sheriff's Dept prior to release.
Defendant shall give written notice prior to any change in address or telephone number to the Clerk of this Court and Defense Attorney.

10:33am Defendant William J. Shecterle appeared, in custody.  Mark T. Fuhr appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case called, appearances and possible charges stated.  Defendant's next court date is 6/28/16 at 10:00am.  Court gives defendant notice of right to attorney and victim/witness intimidation form.  Court questions parties as to bond.  DA states bond recommendation.  Court grants DA 5 business days in which to file complaint.   Court sets signature bond.  Adj. 10:34am
